normalized_lines: One-Pan Honey Garlic Chicken with Green Sauce
1 lb. boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
2 tbsp. chopped cilantro (plus more for serving)
1. Preheat oven to 425 F. Line a sheet pan with parchment.
2. In a bowl, toss chicken with garlic, oil, salt, pepper, and chile flakes. Rest 10 minutes.
3. Whisk honey and soy sauce; pour over chicken. Bake 12 to 15 minutes, then broil 2 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, stir yogurt, tahini, lemon juice, cilantro, and enough water to loosen.
5. Serve chicken over rice with sauce and sesame seeds.
- If using chicken breasts, reduce bake time by 2 to 3 minutes.
- Sauce keeps 2 days in the fridge.
